TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ArrangedElementCollection extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable, class System.Collections.IList

span.span: Represents a collection of objects.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 类表示的排列设计图面上或在父对象的集合。The class represents a collection of objects arranged on a design surface or inside a parent . 没有公开定义的构造函数中由于它旨在仅内部内使用[!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]。There are no publicly defined constructors in because it is designed to be used only internally within the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. 但是，类派生自，如，可供开发人员。However, classes derived from , such as , are available to the developer.

threadsafe.span: 公共(在 Visual Basic 中) 的此类型的成员都是线程安全。

span.span: Public ( in Visual Basic) members of this type are thread safe.

threadsafe.span: 不保证实例成员都是线程安全。

span.span: Instance members are not guaranteed to be thread safe.

threadsafe.span: 同时，可以支持多个读取器，只要不修改该集合。

span.span: An can support multiple readers concurrently, as long as the collection is not modified.

threadsafe.span: 方法返回可用来访问元素。

span.span: The method returns an that can be used to access elements.

threadsafe.span: 枚举整个集合本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。

span.span: Enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure.

threadsafe.span: 即使某个集合已同步，其他线程仍可以修改集合，这会导致枚举数引发异常。

span.span: Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads could still modify the collection, which causes the enumerator to throw an exception.

threadsafe.span: 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举期间锁定集合，或者捕获由其他线程进行的更改所导致的异常。

span.span: To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can either lock the collection during the entire enumeration or catch the exceptions resulting from changes made by other threads.

span.span: The zero-based index in array at which copying begins.

summary.span: 从目标数组的指定索引处开始将此集合的全部内容复制到兼容的一维 。

span.span: Copies the entire contents of this collection to a compatible one-dimensional , starting at the specified index of the target array.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 指定数组的类型必须与源集合兼容。The type of the specified array must be compatible with the source collection. 此方法使用方法将元素复制。This method uses the method to copy the elements.

span.span: The number of elements in the source collection is greater than the available space from to the end of .

exception.span: 源元素的类型不能自动强制转换为 类型。

span.span: The type of the source element cannot be cast automatically to the type of .

span.span: Gets the number of elements in the collection.

value.span: 集合中当前包含的元素数。

span.span: The number of elements currently contained in the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在需要时，将动态增加集合的容量以接受多个元素。When required, the capacity of the collection will dynamically increase to accept more elements.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.IEnumerator GetEnumerator() cil managed
Public Overridable Function GetEnumerator () As IEnumerator

summary.span: 返回一个用于访问整个集合的枚举数。

span.span: Returns an enumerator for the entire collection.

returns.span: 一个用于访问整个集合的 。

span.span: An for the entire collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 通常枚举数没有对集合; 独占访问权因此，枚举整个集合本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。Typically the enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 即使某个集合已同步，其他线程仍可以修改集合，这会导致枚举数引发异常。Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads could still modify the collection, which causes the enumerator to throw an exception. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以遵循以下策略之一：To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can follow one of the following strategies: - 使用整个枚举期间锁定集合。Lock the collection during the entire enumeration using a . - 捕获和处理由其他线程进行的更改导致的异常。Catch and handle the exceptions that result from changes made by other threads.

span.span: Returns the hash code for this instance.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property IsReadOnly As Boolean
public: virtual property bool IsReadOnly { bool get(); };

summary.span: 获取一个值，该值指示集合是否为只读。

span.span: Gets a value indicating whether the collection is read-only.

value.span: 如果该集合为只读，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if the collection is read-only; otherwise, .
The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 只读集合不允许添加、 移除或修改元素的集合在创建后。A read-only collection does not allow the addition, removal, or modification of elements after the collection is created. 只读集合是只是一个使用的包装器可防止修改集合的集合。A read-only collection is simply a collection with a wrapper that prevents modifying the collection. 如果对基础集合进行更改，只读集合将反映这些更改。If changes are made to the underlying collection, the read-only collection reflects those changes.
